title: Call transcription + call viewer (live + post-call)
description:
Add call transcription and a call viewer page for the PWA softphone.

Live transcription:
- Provide streaming transcription updates during an active call.
- Keep UX responsive (partial results / incremental updates).

Post-call viewer:
- After the call ends, show a call detail page with:
  - call metadata (time, direction, remote party, called line if present)
  - recording playback (if recording is enabled)
  - transcript (full text + timestamps when available)

Storage + extensibility:
- Demo storage in local IndexedDB with an export mechanism.
- Keep a provider/plugin interface so transcription can later be powered by Whisper or a BYO backend.

Privacy:
- Require explicit user consent to enable transcription and/or recording.
- Do not persist transcripts/recordings by default unless the user enables persistence.
acceptance_criteria:
- Live transcription is visible during a call (updates incrementally).
- Call viewer page exists and shows transcript and recording playback when available.
- IndexedDB persistence works for demo; export works.
- Transcription/recording are opt-in (explicit user consent); default is non-persistent.
- Docs explain how to plug in a Whisper/BYO transcription backend.

title: Define TranscriptionProvider interface + wire to CallSession audio
description: Define a TranscriptionProvider interface in core and connect it to the call audio stream lifecycle (start/stop, partial/final updates).

title: Web Speech API transcription provider (demo)
description: Implement a demo transcription provider using the browser Web Speech API (where supported), emitting partial and final transcript segments.

title: Recording capture via MediaRecorder + optional upload hook
description: Capture call audio via MediaRecorder when enabled; store blobs locally and expose an optional upload hook interface for future integrations.

title: PWA call viewer UI (history -> detail with transcript + playback)
description: Add a call detail view reachable from call history showing metadata, transcript, and recording playback when available.

title: IndexedDB persistence for transcripts + recordings metadata
description: Implement persistence layer in IndexedDB for transcript segments, call metadata linkage, and recording metadata/blob references; default off unless user enabled.

title: Docs: plug in Whisper / BYO transcription backend
description: Document the TranscriptionProvider contract and a reference integration path for Whisper or any external backend (streaming + batch).

title: Merge clean branches: feat/dependency-janitor-workflow, feature/ai-insights-playground-demo, feature/tutorial-part-5-ai-insights, fix-docs-dead-links, fix/softphone-46elks
Provider-aware outbound calling strategies (46elks REST originate, standards)
description:
## Problem
Some outbound calling providers do not support the *standard* approach of sending a direct SIP INVITE to originate a PSTN call.

A common pitfall: **46elks requires outbound PSTN calls to be originated via their REST API** (call control / originate). If developers attempt a direct SIP INVITE against 46elks for PSTN, calls fail in confusing ways (looks like a SIP bug but it is a provider capability mismatch).

## Desired behavior
- Outbound dialing is **provider-aware** and selects the correct strategy automatically (or with clear configuration).
- If the provider does not support direct SIP INVITE for PSTN, the app/library surfaces **clear UX copy** explaining what is supported and how to configure it.
- For providers that support standards-based SIP trunking / SIP INVITE originate, keep the default standards flow.

## Scope
- Add a dial-strategy abstraction that can select between:
  - standards-based SIP INVITE originate
  - 46elks REST-originated outbound calling (then bridge/connect)
- Move any provider-specific originate logic into the **core library**, not only templates/examples.
- Add provider capability detection/flags + UX copy for unsupported modes.
- Add documentation for provider-specific outbound calling and a security note for API credentials/callback endpoints.
- Add automated tests covering dial strategy selection.

Non-goals (for now): implement additional provider REST originate flows beyond 46elks; the design should remain extensible.

title: Merge Review: feat/dependency-janitor-workflow-2585834929435917164 -> main

title: Production hardening for softphone
description:
## Goal
Prepare the softphone for production deployment with hardening, testing, and optimization.

## Scope

### Security Hardening
- Credential storage security review
- XSS/CSRF protection verification
- Content Security Policy
- Secure WebSocket connections
- API key handling best practices

### Performance Optimization
- Bundle size optimization
- Lazy loading strategies
- Memory leak prevention
- Audio/video performance tuning

### Testing
- Unit test coverage (>80%)
- Integration tests for call flows
- E2E tests with Playwright
- Cross-browser testing
- Mobile device testing

### Reliability
- Error monitoring integration (Sentry, etc.)
- Analytics for call quality metrics
- Crash reporting
- Performance monitoring

### Documentation
- Deployment guide
- Configuration reference
- Troubleshooting guide
- API documentation

### Accessibility Audit
- WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
- Screen reader testing
- Keyboard navigation verification

## Success Criteria
- All tests passing
- No critical security issues
- Performance benchmarks met
- Documentation complete

title: PWA softphone calls use only host ICE candidates (rtcConfiguration not applied)
description: PWA softphone sets SipClientConfig.rtcConfiguration (STUN servers), but outgoing INVITE SDP still only contains host ICE candidates. Root cause: src/core/SipClient.ts passes options.rtcConfiguration only, and does not map config.rtcConfiguration into JsSIP's expected pcConfig. Fix: default rtcConfiguration from config and pass it as both rtcConfiguration + pcConfig (also for answering).
close_reason: Fixed SipClient to default rtcConfiguration from config and pass it to JsSIP as pcConfig; added unit coverage.

title: Build feature-rich softphone MVP
description:
## Goal
Implement MVP of feature-rich softphone based on research findings.

## Prerequisites
- Provider login options implemented (VueSIP-unp)
- Provider research completed (VueSIP-wxf)
- Feature/UI research completed (VueSIP-ysr)

## MVP Scope (TBD based on research)
Likely includes:
- Provider selector with 46elks, Telnyx, and researched providers
- Modern, responsive UI
- Core calling features
- Call history
- Device settings
- Basic recording support
- PWA installability

## Implementation Approach
- Build on PWA softphone template
- Use VueSIP composables
- Mobile-first responsive design
- Progressive enhancement

## Success Criteria
- Functional calling with multiple providers
- Clean, intuitive UI
- Works offline-capable (PWA)
- Accessible design

title: Improve enterprise tests in enterprise package
Multi incoming numbers (DID-aware + multi-account)
description:
Support multiple incoming numbers for the PWA softphone, in two modes:

(A) DID-aware routing with a single SIP registration
- One SIP account/registration receives calls to multiple inbound DIDs.
- App extracts called-number info from SIP INVITE fields/headers and routes/labels accordingly.

(B) Multiple SIP accounts registered simultaneously
- Multiple SIP accounts (multiple registrations) can be active at once.
- Incoming calls are associated with the correct account/line.

Providers to target:
- 46elks
- FreePBX/Asterisk
- Telnyx

Extraction model (shared across providers)
- Build a `calledNumberCandidates[]` list from INVITE fields/headers (e.g., Request-URI, To, P-Called-Party-ID, Diversion/History-Info).
- Each candidate stores `source`, `raw`, and `normalized` (keep both raw + normalized).
- Derive two concepts from candidates:
  - `dialed`: what was dialed into the trunk/registration.
  - `target`: the effective DID/line after forwarding/diversion.
- Precedence is configurable; ship sensible defaults (and provider presets) for dialed/target selection.

Core requirement:
- Expose extracted values on CallSession (candidates + dialed + target; raw + normalized).
- Surface "Called number" / "Line" clearly in the PWA UI on incoming call toast/banner + in-call screen.

Config/presets:
- TypeScript config schema + provider presets to control sources, precedence, and normalization.

UX defaults:
- Default to mode (A).
- Put mode (B) behind an "Advanced" toggle/settings gate.
acceptance_criteria:
- Called-number/line identity is captured on incoming calls and available on CallSession.
- UI shows "Called number" / "Line" on incoming call and in-call screen.
- Demonstrate end-to-end with at least one hosted provider (46elks or Telnyx) AND one PBX setup (FreePBX/Asterisk).
- Documentation exists for all three providers (46elks, Telnyx, FreePBX/Asterisk) covering DID routing expectations and header behavior.

title: Implement called-number extraction into CallSession metadata
description:
Implement called-number extraction into CallSession metadata.

Scope:
- Define a TypeScript config schema + defaults (and provider preset selection/override) for which sources to extract from and precedence for dialed vs target.
- Extract a `calledNumberCandidates[]` list (each with `source`, `raw`, `normalized`).
- Compute and store `dialed` and `target` from candidates using the default precedence (overrideable via config/preset).
- Persist everything on CallSession metadata for UI + logging.
acceptance_criteria:
- TypeScript config schema + defaults exist (exported types + default values) and are used when no config is provided.
- Incoming INVITE extraction stores `calledNumberCandidates[]` (raw + normalized + source) on CallSession metadata.
- Extraction also stores derived `dialed` and `target` values on CallSession metadata (each raw + normalized + source) computed from candidates via default precedence.
- Provider preset can be selected and precedence overridden via config.
close_reason: Implemented called identity extraction (candidates + dialed/target), improved History-Info/Diversion handling, added tests

title: Show called number/line in PWA incoming + in-call UI
description: Add UI fields for incoming call banner/toast and call screen to display the called DID/line identity from CallSession.
close_reason: PWA shows called line on incoming modal, in-call screen, and push notification body

title: Multi-account manager abstraction + account persistence
description: Introduce an abstraction to manage multiple SipClient instances (one per account), including persisted account list + active registrations.
close_reason: Added core multi-account composables (useMultiSipClient, useSipAccountManager) to manage multiple SipClient instances from persisted settings

title: Advanced UI: manage SIP accounts + choose outbound account
description: Add advanced settings UI to add/remove SIP accounts, enable multi-account mode, and select the outbound account per call.

title: Docs: provider routing notes for multi-DID inbound
description: Write provider notes for FreePBX/Asterisk, Telnyx, and 46elks describing how to route multiple DIDs and which SIP headers carry the called number.
close_reason: Added multi-DID provider routing guide (46elks, Telnyx, FreePBX/Asterisk) + calledIdentity config notes

title: Unit tests for called-number header parsing
description: Add unit tests that cover common inbound header combinations (Request-URI, To, P-Called-Party-ID, Diversion) and normalization rules.
close_reason: Added called identity extraction unit tests (History-Info, Diversion, ruri object, percent decoding)

title: Add provider login options to PWA softphone (46elks, Telnyx)
description:
## Goal
Update the PWA softphone template to match the login experience of the basic-softphone template.

## Current State
- PWA softphone only has manual SIP credential entry (WebSocket server, SIP URI, password)
- No provider selector dropdown
- No 46elks or Telnyx API login integration

## Target State
Add similar login options as basic-softphone:

1. **Provider Selector Dropdown** - Use `useProviderSelector` composable
2. **46elks API Login** - Reuse/adapt `Elks46ApiLogin.vue` component
3. **Telnyx API Login** - Reuse/adapt `TelnyxApiLogin.vue` component  
4. **Dynamic Provider Form** - Support other providers (own-pbx, etc.)
5. **Manual Entry Fallback** - Allow switching between API and manual login

## Implementation Notes
- Adapt PrimeVue components from basic-softphone to PWA's vanilla CSS approach
- Maintain PWA's mobile-first design aesthetic
- Keep credential persistence in localStorage
- Support `useProviderSelector` from vuesip core

## Reference Files
- `templates/basic-softphone/src/App.vue` - Provider selector implementation
- `templates/basic-softphone/src/components/Elks46ApiLogin.vue` - 46elks API flow
- `templates/basic-softphone/src/components/TelnyxApiLogin.vue` - Telnyx API flow
- `templates/pwa-softphone/src/components/Settings.vue` - Current login form
close_reason: Provider login options added: ProviderSelector, Elks46Login, TelnyxLogin components with Settings.vue integration

title: Provider-aware outbound calling strategies (46elks REST originate, standards)
description:
## Problem
Some outbound calling providers do not support the *standard* approach of sending a direct SIP INVITE to originate a PSTN call.

A common pitfall: **46elks requires outbound PSTN calls to be originated via their REST API** (call control / originate). If developers attempt a direct SIP INVITE against 46elks for PSTN, calls fail in confusing ways (looks like a SIP bug but it is a provider capability mismatch).

## Desired behavior
- Outbound dialing is **provider-aware** and selects the correct strategy automatically (or with clear configuration).
- If the provider does not support direct SIP INVITE for PSTN, the app/library surfaces **clear UX copy** explaining what is supported and how to configure it.
- For providers that support standards-based SIP trunking / SIP INVITE originate, keep the default standards flow.

## Scope
- Add a dial-strategy abstraction that can select between:
  - standards-based SIP INVITE originate
  - 46elks REST-originated outbound calling (then bridge/connect)
- Move any provider-specific originate logic into the **core library**, not only templates/examples.
- Add provider capability detection/flags + UX copy for unsupported modes.
- Add documentation for provider-specific outbound calling and a security note for API credentials/callback endpoints.
- Add automated tests covering dial strategy selection.

Non-goals (for now): implement additional provider REST originate flows beyond 46elks; the design should remain extensible.

title: Implement 46elks REST originate in core library (not only PWA template)
description:
Move/implement the 46elks REST originate flow into the shared/core library so all clients (not just the PWA template) can originate outbound PSTN calls correctly.

Acceptance:
- Core library exposes a dial strategy/adapter for 46elks REST originate
- Template uses the core implementation (no duplicated logic)
- Configuration for API credentials/callback URLs is documented at call site

title: Provider capability detection + UX copy when direct SIP INVITE not supported
description:
Add provider capability detection (or explicit config flags) and user-facing messaging so developers/operators understand when direct SIP INVITE outbound originate is not supported.

Acceptance:
- Capability matrix / config documented in code
- Clear error/UX copy points to correct strategy (e.g., 46elks requires REST originate)
close_reason: Added two-line call status UX for 46elks bridge flow in PWA softphone (Calling <number> + bridge stage text), so users see what's happening without needing SIP traces.

title: Docs: provider-specific outbound calling guide + security note
description:
Add a docs/guide section that explains provider-specific outbound calling strategies (standards-based SIP originate vs provider REST originate like 46elks).

Include security note:
- Protect API tokens/credentials
- Validate inbound webhooks/callbacks
- Avoid logging sensitive call-control payloads

title: Add automated tests for dial strategy selection (unit/integration)
description:
Add automated test coverage ensuring outbound dial strategy selection works as intended.

Acceptance:
- Unit tests cover capability/config matrix
- Integration-style tests (where possible) assert correct code path for 46elks REST originate vs direct SIP INVITE

title: Enterprise: CI and Quality Gates
CI: enterprise lint + unit tests on PRs
notes: Adding enterprise lint+tests CI workflow

title: CI: coverage thresholds for enterprise tests
Docs: enterprise usage examples (analytics/compliance/CRM)
Tests: expand CRM adapter edge cases and error handling
Research popular WebRTC/SIP providers and their API requirements
description:
## Goal
Research and document popular WebRTC/SIP providers to expand VueSIP's provider support beyond 46elks and Telnyx.

## Research Areas

### Provider Discovery
- Identify popular WebRTC/SIP providers used by developers
- Focus on providers with WebRTC browser support
- Consider both enterprise and developer-friendly options

### Per-Provider Documentation
For each provider, document:
1. **Authentication method** - API keys, OAuth, username/password
2. **WebSocket endpoint format** - WSS URL patterns
3. **SIP URI format** - How users/extensions are addressed
4. **API capabilities** - Number provisioning, call history, recordings
5. **Pricing model** - Pay-as-you-go vs subscription
6. **Documentation quality** - API docs, SDKs, examples

### Current Providers in VueSIP
- 46elks (Swedish, API-based provisioning)
- Telnyx (US-based, credential connection)
- Own PBX (generic SIP server)

### Potential Providers to Research
- Twilio (market leader)
- Vonage/Nexmo
- Plivo
- Bandwidth
- SignalWire
- VoIP.ms
- Flowroute
- Sinch

## Deliverables
- Provider comparison matrix
- Provider config schemas for `useProviderSelector`
- Implementation priority recommendations
close_reason: Completed provider research. Documentation at claudedocs/provider-research.md. Recommended: Twilio/Plivo (high priority), SignalWire/Sinch (medium). Config schemas documented.

title: Add conflict resolution handling for call issues
description:
## Goal
Implement robust conflict resolution and error handling for common call issues.

## Scope

### Network Issues
- WebSocket disconnection recovery
- Automatic reconnection with backoff
- Network quality indicators
- Graceful degradation

### Call State Conflicts
- Multiple simultaneous incoming calls
- Call waiting implementation
- Concurrent session management
- State synchronization

### Audio Issues
- Device switching during call
- Microphone permission recovery
- Audio routing conflicts
- Echo cancellation feedback

### Registration Issues
- Re-registration on failure
- Credential expiration handling
- Multi-device registration conflicts

### User Feedback
- Clear error messages
- Recovery action suggestions
- Status indicators for connection health

## Implementation
- Error boundary components
- Retry strategies
- User notification system
- Logging for debugging

title: Fix 46elks API login on deployed softphone
description: softphone.vuesip.com (PWA softphone) errors parsing 46elks API JSON (receives HTML <!DOCTYPE>) because /api/46elks proxy is not deployed for the *pwa-softphone* Pages project. The proxy exists as a Pages Function, but deploy uploads dist/ only. Ensure templates/pwa-softphone includes functions in dist output (dist/functions/api/46elks/*) so /api/46elks/a1 routes resolve.
close_reason: softphone.vuesip.com maps to the PWA softphone (templates/pwa-softphone). Added a Cloudflare Pages Function proxy for /api/46elks/a1/* and ensured it is included in dist/ by copying functions/ into dist/functions during build. This prevents index.html HTML fallback being parsed as JSON.

title: Research feature-rich softphone UI/UX and capabilities
description:
## Goal
Research and document features for a modern, feature-rich softphone application.

## Research Areas

### UI/UX Patterns
- Modern softphone UI designs (desktop & mobile)
- Call screen layouts and animations
- Dial pad ergonomics
- Contact management patterns
- Call history visualization
- Settings/configuration UX

### Core Features
- Basic calling (make/receive/transfer)
- Call hold/resume
- Mute/unmute
- Speaker toggle
- DTMF keypad during call

### Advanced Features
- Call recording
- Call transcription (real-time)
- Video calling
- Screen sharing
- Conference calling
- Voicemail access
- Call forwarding/DND
- Presence/status indicators
- Push notifications (PWA)

### Integration Features
- CRM integrations (click-to-call)
- Contact sync
- Call logging to external systems
- Webhooks for call events

### Accessibility
- WCAG compliance considerations
- Keyboard navigation
- Screen reader support
- High contrast modes

## Deliverables
- Feature priority matrix (must-have vs nice-to-have)
- UI mockup references/inspirations
- Implementation recommendations for PWA softphone
close_reason: Comprehensive research completed. Created claudedocs/softphone-feature-research.md with: VueSIP feature inventory (77+ composables), gap analysis, UI/UX patterns, PWA requirements, accessibility standards, and prioritized MVP roadmap.
